item.title: How Language shapes the way we Think
item.description: Charlemagne, Holy Roman emperor, said, “To have a second language is to have a second soul” – strong statement that language crafts reality. But on the other hand, Shakespeare said, “What’s in a name? A rose by any other name would smell as sweet.” Well, that suggests that maybe language doesn’t craft reality. Do the languages we speak shape the way we see the world, the way we think, and the way we live our lives?
